column4: Hey guys, I just had a really weird  problem. I loaded up the Ubuntu LiveCD on my computer for the first time, and it ran fine. Maybe a little slower than I remember it being on other PCs. Then I tried to restart, and it beeped twice and immediately powered down.
Then my PC wouldn't turn on again....
I had to turn off the power supply, unplug it, then plug it back in and go. Then it worked.
did you flip the switch in back, wait 30 seconds and try again?
make sure a video card or sound-card didn't come out the slot also.
Yeah, and that worked. But before I did that it wouldn't power up. Any idea what caused that?
I have ubuntu on my laptop, and I decided to try the LiveCD for shits and giggles on my desktop, then that happened.
In your bios is any of the "cache to RAM/Memory" options enabled?
Haven't checked. Although I did update my BIOS today...
Hmm... While I was in the LiveCD, I tried to install the NVIDIA drivers through the restricted package manager, and I have an 8800. Do the drivers maybe not support 8800s?
Just the drivers in the Restricted Package Manager.... not sure what those are.
if you installed proprietary drivers that's probably what did it.
I hope so. I'm a little scared to try loading the CD up again though just in case, hehe. :)
Run memtestx86 from the liveCD overnight, aswell as prime95 (two instances, one per core as the afinity) in windows for atleast 6 hours
